query: How do extensions of the standard model, such as supersymmetric extensions, build upon our current understanding of CP violation and its role in new physics beyond the electroweak standard model?

citation_function_classification.justification: The query seeks to understand how extensions of the standard model build upon our current understanding of CP violation and its role in new physics beyond the electroweak standard model. This requires knowledge of the standard model itself, as well as motivation for exploring beyond it.
